body: The University of Cambridge is at the top of the league table, retaining first place for the sixth year running, followed by Oxford and St Andrews in the Guardian’s undergraduate university league table. Loughborough is this year’s newcomer in the top 10, coming in at fourth place, up from 11th place last year. Bath has slipped from number five to number 10 this year.  Lancaster gained two, to number eight, and Warwick lost three positions and is now at number nine. Surrey, Durham and Imperial College stayed in the same places as last year. Exeter is the only school knocked out of the top 10, going from ninth to 11th place. The biggest drop is Liverpool John Moores University, down 26 places from 58 to 84. Queen Margaret University drops 25 places out of the top 100 to place 101 and Brighton falls 24 places to 91st place. City University climbs 19 places and gets into the top 20 at position 18. The biggest climber is Sunderland, up 30 places, going from 109th to 79th place.  Liverpool Hope appears in the top 100, going from 104th place to 79th and Derby regained the position it had in 2014, by going from 73rd to 48th. Also Bradford and Anglia Ruskin gained more than 20 places to rise into 52nd and 66th place respectively.   Universities with biggest changes in rankings 2015-16   The tables were compiled by the independent consultancy firm Intelligent Metrix. They are based on information collected by the Higher Education Statistics Agency (Hesa) and the National Student Survey, published by Higher Education Funding Council for England (Hefce). The Guardian University Guide 2016 is a ranking at undergraduate level only. The Guardian undergraduate university guide can be explored below alongside information such as spend per student, student-to-staff ratio and institutions’ value-added score. Click on the downloadable spreadsheet to view the individual rankings by subject. We’d love to read your comments in the thread below.  Data: download the tables in full Expore the league tables using our interactive  This article was amended on 10 June 2016 to correct Warwick’s position in the league table.
webTitle: The Guardian University Guide 2017: download the tables in full
